member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ITokenProvider
member.summary: Provides methods that map metadata references onto PE file tokens.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ITokenProvider.GetTokenFor(Microsoft.Cci.IFieldReference)
member.summary: Returns the metadata token value that is used instead of the given field reference when serializing metadata using the PE file format.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ITokenProvider.GetTokenFor(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodReference)
member.summary: Returns the metadata token value that is used instead of the given method reference when serializing metadata using the PE file format.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ITokenProvider.GetTokenFor(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)
member.summary: Returns the metadata token value that is used instead of the given type reference when serializing metadata using the PE file format.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ITokenProvider.GetTokenFor(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the metadata token value that is used instead of the given string when serializing metadata using the PE file format.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeWriter.FoldStrings
member.summary: Fills in stringIndexMap with data from stringIndex and write to stringWriter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeWriter.ComputeSizeOfVersionString(System.Byte[])
member.summary: returns a multiple 4 that is at least 12 and at most 256 and that is just big enough to hold the version string.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeWriter.GetDefiningUnitReference(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)
member.summary: Returns a reference to the unit that defines the given referenced type. If the referenced type is a structural type, such as a pointer or a generic type instance, then the result is null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeWriter.GetCorrespondingMethodToken(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition)
member.summary: Deals with the case where the given method is from a module that is being rewritten or merged into this.module. The method comes from the synchronization information for the current method and this information could still be that obtained from the PDB of the module being rewritten or merged.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.PeWriter.StringIdx
member.summary: Wraps a virtual string table index. An override to SerializeIndex does the resolving at the right time.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.PeWriter.SuffixSort
member.summary: Sorts strings such that a string is followed immediately by all strings that are a suffix of it.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.CustomSectionProvider
member.summary: Called by the PEWriter to allow a plug-in to provide a custom section that will be stored in the PE file along with the sections that contain serialized metadata.
member.param: A somewhat random collection of values that can be useful to know about a PE file, but which cannot be obtained from a metadata model.
A mapper from metadata objects to the tokens that will be used in the PE file being writtern.
member.returns: An IPESection objet that is to be serialized into the PE file being written out by PEWriter (which is calling this delegate).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.PEFileData
member.summary: A somewhat random collection of values that can be useful to know about a PE file, but which cannot be obtained from a metadata model. These values can be persisted inside a custom section and help a reader of the custom section to quickly find values in the standard sections of the PE file. They can also be used to verify that the custom section matches to the PE file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.PEFileData.timeStamp
member.summary: The time stamp that the PE writer will write into the PE file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.PEFileData.wellKnownTypes
member.summary: Type def tokens for the "well known" types. Only non null if the PE file contains the "core" .NET library which defines System.Object. The types are: System.Object, System.String, System.ValueType, System.Enum, System.Array, System.Boolean, System.Void, System.Char, System.SByte System.Byte, System.UInt16, System.Int32, System.UInt32, System.Int64, System.UInt64, System.Single, System.Double, System.IntPtr, System.UIntPtr, System.MarshalByRefObject, System.MultiCastDelegate, System.Nullable, System.__Canon, System.Runtime.Remoting.Proxies.__TransparentProxy System.__ComObject, System.ContextBoundObject.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.PEFileData.offsetToMethodDefTable
member.summary: The offset from the start of the metadata tables to the first row of the first MethodDef table.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.PEFileData.methodDefRecordSize
member.summary: The size of a row of the MethodDef table.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.PEFileData.methodDefCount
member.summary: The number of rows in the MethodDef table.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.PEFileData.offsetToFieldRvaTable
member.summary: The offset from the start of the metadata tables, to the first row of the FieldRVA table.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.PEFileData.fieldRvaRecordSize
member.summary: The size of a row of the FieldRVA table.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.PEFileData.fieldRvaCount
member.summary: The number of rows in the FieldRVA table.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.PEFileData.ilImageSize
member.summary: The number of bytes in the PE image (as reported in the NT header).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.PEFileData.targetProcessorArchitecture
member.summary: The particular processor architecture required by the assembly in the PE file being written. Architecture independent assemblies will report X86 as their architecture.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.TargetProcessorArchitecture
member.summary: An enumeration of processor architectures.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.TargetProcessorArchitecture.X86
member.summary: Intel x86

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.TargetProcessorArchitecture.X64
member.summary: AMD x64

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.TargetProcessorArchitecture.IA64
member.summary: Intel IA64

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.TargetProcessorArchitecture.ARM
member.summary: ARM

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.PeWriterInternal.ReferenceIndexer.typeReferenceNeedsToken
member.summary: True if the type reference is traversed from a location that needs a token for the type reference.
